loans.name: Nightingale

texts.en:
Nightingale is married and has three children. Nightingale is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Nightingale is a farmer who raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. 

She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase three piglets and three sacks of feed and vitamins.

Nightingale has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Nightingale hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase of three piglets, three sacks of feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth is married and has three children. Ruth is 45 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Ruth sells kangkong, a leafy green vegetable, to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this work. 

She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to be used for purchasing additional kangkong to sell.

Ruth has been a member of PMPC for seven years.  

In the future, Ruth hopes to engage in another kind of business. Ruth is the leader of a five-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To purchase additional kangkong to sell.

loans.name: Nida Fe

texts.en:
Nida is 54 years old and lives in Buenavista, Pagadian City. She is married and has five children.

To earn a living, she has a general store. She earns about 5,000 PHP a month doing this work. 

She has a requested loan amount of 10,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

She has been a member of PMPC for almost a year. In the future, she hopes to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 38 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is a single mother with one child. 

Grace has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this work. 

She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more stocks for her general store.
 
Grace has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Grace hopes to have her child finish her studies.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a 26-year-old married woman with one child. Her husband's name is Alfred and he works as a procurement officer. For the past six months, Salama has operated a business selling charcoal from home. Her primary customers are charcoal retailers. Salama's other source of income is her husband's income and her greatest business challenge is seasonality. She rents a house with electricity and running water and her greatest monthly expense is food. Salama joined Yehu to access capital to expand her business.

Salama is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to construct a shed for her business. She aspires to hire employees in the future.

loans.use: to construct a shed for her charcoal-selling business

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana lives in Lchashen village. She is cosmetologist but has never worked in this business. Liana has two small children, a son and a daughter, and her husband sometimes works in construction. Liana works as a farmer and animal breeder in her village which is in an area of Sevan. Since her husband's work is not regular, he helps her with farming. Together, they breed cows, sheep, and chickens. The also cultivate potatoes and sell their milk and meat to retailers and butcher shops. They use some of their produce for their family. Thanks to their agriculture business, Liana and her husband are able to provide for their family.

Liana is requesting a 2,500 USD loan to buy calves, potato seedlings, and fertilizer for her farm before the sowing season.

loans.use: to buy calves, potato seedlings, and fertilizer

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is 25 years old and single. He operates as a bread supplier and sells his goods at wholesale. He has worked in this business for five years. His primary customers are community members and retail shop operators. 

Ismail is requesting a loan for 60,000 KES, which he will use to purchase bread to resell.  He describes his greatest business challenge to be credit defaulters. His highest monthly expenses are food, hospital bills, and clothing. He rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Ismail aspires to expand and have a permanent business premise in the future. He joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase bread to resell.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Anthony is requesting another loan for 40,000 KES, which he will use to establish a poultry business. With the loan, he wants to purchase chicks and chicken feeds. Since the previous loan, his monthly profits have increased by 50 percent.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en: Bakari is requesting another loan for 80,000 KES, which he will use to boost his motorcycle business. With the loan, he wants to purchase another motorcycle for his transport business. Since the previous loan, his monthly income has increased,  he has been able to meet his family's basic needs, and his family's living conditions have improved.

loans.use: to purchase another  motorcycle for transport business.

loans.name: La Trinite De Bedou 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Philomene est le coordinateur  de son groupe La Trinite de Bedou. Elle n'est pas marié  et elle  a 2 enfants. Philomene habite dans la région BEDOU Nord’est  d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Elle a dirigé son  commerce pendant les 4 dernières années. 

Philomene voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir à vendre le commerce du charbon. Des autres membres de La Trinite de Bedou ont besoin d’un emprunt pour leur commerces. Philomene dit que ses défis/son défi principal est un grand commercant.
texts.en: Philomene is the coordinator of the Trinité group of Bedou. She is single and has two children. Philome lives in the Bedou region, in the North of Haiti, where electricity is scarce and access to water very limited. She has been running a business for four years. Philomee would like to use this loan to invest in her charcoal business. The other group members also need a loan for their business. Philomene says that her main challenge is [becoming] a major vendor.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is married and has four children who attend school. Her husband works as a shopkeeper. Patience operates a vegetable kiosk and sells her goods in a shop. She has worked in this business for four years. Her primary customers are passersby and neighbors. Patience's other source of income includes her husband's income. 

Patience is requesting a loan for 40,000 KES, which she will use to expand into a general kiosk and purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, and sugar. She describes her greatest business challenge to be transportation; her highest monthly expense is school fees. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Patience aspires to own a wholesale shop in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Virtue Group

texts.en:
Mecel is 25 years old lives in Luy-a, Tukuran ZDS. She is married and has two children.

Mecel is involved in a farming business, specifically, gardening, and she earns PHP 9,500 each month doing this work.

She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for her gardens.

Mecel has been a member of PMPC for almost one year. In the future, Mecel hopes to expand her farming business and make it more progressive.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her gardens.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 39 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two children.
 
Nora has a general store. She has had this business for two years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Nora has been a member of PMPC almost a year. In the future, Nora hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Sorothani

texts.en:
Sorothani is a married man with five children, all of whom attend school. For the past two years, he has operated a vegetable stall and he sells his products to neighbors and passersby. His major business challenge is the high cost of transportation. Sorothani owns a house without electricity or running water and his greatest monthly expense is school fees. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

Sorothani is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to start a meat business and purchase two goats to sell for meat. In the future, he dreams of expanding his business to wholesale.

loans.use: to start a meat business and purchase two goats

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman. She has seven children, one of whom is enrolled in school. Her husband's name is Edward and he is retired. 

Alice operates a greengrocer business and sells her goods in a shop. She has worked in this business for seven years. Her primary customers are passersby and neighbors. Alice's other source of income includes her children's income. She describes her greatest business challenge to be transportation and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Alice will use the KES 50,000 loan to open a retail shop and purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. Alice aspires to own a cereals wholesale business in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a 35-year-old widowed woman. She has five children and all are enrolled in school. 

Mbeyu operates a retail kiosk and sells her goods at the market. She has worked in this business for two years. Her primary customers are the community. Mbeyu's other source of income includes farming. She describes her greatest business challenge to be high prices and her highest monthly expenses are food, school fees, and healthcare. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mbeyu will use the KES 25,000 loan to purchase rice, sugar, and cooking fat. Mbeyu aspires to expand the business venture in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a 61-year-old married woman. She has five children. 

Mlongo operates a retail shop and sells her goods in a shop. She has worked in this business for four years. Her primary customers are community members. She describes her greatest business challenge to be changing prices and her highest monthly expenses are food, healthcare, and clothing. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mlongo will use the KES 80,000 loan to purchase rice, sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, and cooking fat. 

Mlongo aspires to own a permanent business premises in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Afessi

texts.fr:
Afessi est une femme âgé(e) de 38 ans. Elle est mariée å un pasteur avec 04 enfants en charge.
Afessi travaille comme revendeuse d’alimentation générale(riz, huile végétale,sucre ,détergents) depuis 2010. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et sert ses clients dans une boutique.
Afessi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises. Son désir est de devenir grossiste et de mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: Afessi is a 38-year old woman, who is married to a pastor and has four children in her care. She has been selling general groceries (rice, vegetable oil, sugar, detergents) since 2010, gets her supplies in Lomé and serves her customers in a shop. Afessi has requested her first loan from WAGES so that she can buy more stock. Her wish is to become a wholesaler and be able to take better care of her family.

loans.use: to buy general groceries

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es: Jairo de 27 años de edad, tienen su propio negocio donde ofrece el servicio de fotocopiaje y  de vídeo juegos. Cuando Jairo inició su actividad lo hizo observando la necesidad que tenia el sector de un lugar cercano donde sacar fotocopias, su negocio fue exitoso y ha ido agregando servicios de transcripciones y de videojuegos para niño. Ahora sueña con tener un local propio y enfocarse también hacia la actividad comercial, afín a este servicio. Su mayor desafío futuro es ubicar un espacio donde lograr esta clientela y  en la actualidad  su desafío es tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para invertir y diversificar su oferta. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará útiles de papelería  y actualizará los videojuegos, para hacer una oferta más moderna a los niños y jóvenes, que cada vez están mas ávidos de cambios y ellos son sus principales clientes. Mientras esto ocurre, cada día se despierta dispuesto a trabajar persistentemente, su rentabilidad sobre las ventas es no menores a un 29% y rota las cuentas por cobrar diariamente, indicadores financieros desde los cuales se proyecta su crecimiento empresarial  .
texts.en:
Jairo is 27 years old and has his own business where he offers photocopying service and video games.  When Jairo started this activity, he noticed that there was a need for a place nearby to make photocopies.  His business was successful, so he started adding transcription services and video games for children.  

Now his dream is to have his own shop and also focus on commercial activity related to this service.  His biggest challenge of the future is to locate a space where he can reach this clientele and in so doing his challenge will be to have sufficient working capital to invest and diversify his offerings.  

This is the reason he looks to Kiva, the first funding to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will use to buy stationary products and update his video games collection, in order to offer more modern ones to children and young people, who are becoming more eager for changes and are his top customers.  In the meantime, each day he gets up ready to work hard, his profitability over sales is no less than 29%, and turnover on accounts receivable is daily.  These are economic indicators which he uses to project business growth.

loans.use: to buy stationary items and update video games

loans.name: Segunda Oliva

texts.es:
SEGUNDA OLIVA tiene  32 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 4 hijos, vive con el conyugue y los hijos de 12, 10, 9 y 7 años de edad en Chillanes provincia de los Ríos.

SEGUNDA OLIVA se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de tomate de árbol, además se dedica al negocio de prendas de vestir, bisutería. 

Solicita el crédito para poder comprar plantas de tomate, abono orgánico, líquidos para las plagas, urea, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los abonos. 

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Chillanes. El sueño es poder construir  una casa en la ciudad de Riobamba e incrementar los cultivos.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son la falta de trabajo y de dinero. En el tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse a los hijos, pasear, ver televisión. Escuchar música, y disfrutar de las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Segunda Oliva, 32, lives in a common-law relationship.  She has four children and lives with her spouse and the children, ages 12, 10, 9, and 7, in Chillanes, province of Los Ríos.

Segunda works in agriculture growing tomato plants.  She also has a business selling clothing and costume jewelry. 

Segunda is requesting the loan to buy tomato plants, organic fertilizer, liquid herbicide for pests, urea, and fertilizer.  With the help of the loan she will be able to buy the fertilizers.

She buys and sells in Chillanes.  Her dream is to be able to build a house in the city of Riobamba and increase her crops.

The challenges she faces are the lack of work and of money.  In her free time she likes to be with her children, go out, watch television, listen to music, and enjoy the Carnival festivals.

loans.use: to buy tomato plants, organic fertilizer, liquid herbicide for pests, urea, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Wilian Uvaldo

texts.es:
WILIAN UVALDO tiene 18 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Chillanes provincia de Bolívar.

 WILIAN UVALDO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, Además se dedica al comercio de madera y cría de pollos.

Solicita el crédito para comprar madera. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar madera para revender a un buen precio y obtener mejor ingreso.

Las comprar y las ventas lo hace en la parroquia San José de Tambo.

 El sueño es poder seguir estudiando y obtener el título de contador. En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte indor, boli, fútbol y disfrutar de las festividades de la  comunidad la cumbia baja.
texts.en:
Wilian Uvaldo, 18, is single, has no children and lives with his parents in Chillanes in the province of Bolivar. 

Wilian is a farmer who sows corn and cocoa, sells wood and raises chickens.

He is requesting this loan to buy cured wood. With the help of the loan he’ll be able to buy more wood to re-sell at a good price and thus improve his income. 

His dream is to continue studying and become an accountant. 

In his spare time, he likes to play indoor volleyball and soccer, and enjoys the community festivities in Cumbia baja.

loans.use: to purchase wood

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has three children, all of whom are in school. She doesn't take care of additional family members.

Teddy has a business of selling bunches of bananas. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Teddy sells her products at the market, by means of retail.

Teddy has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. The main business challenge(s) for Teddy include transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on wholesale only and to own a delivery van to ease transportation. Teddy lives in a home that she owns; she has access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Siyaya

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia Siyaya,alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas,perfumes,colonias y joyas,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual mediante este negocio la socia sale adelante ,ella vende su mercaderia  a sus amistades y familares ,la socia a la vez es estudiante de la carrera profesional de contabilidad ,la socia aun esta en media carrera profesional ;la socia desea invertir en sus estudios.

La socia  solicito el prestamo para pagar sus mensualidades de la universidad.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “CHOQUEQUIRAO” communal bank, which is located in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Siyaya, who combines her daily activities with her business selling beauty products such as creams, perfumes, colognes and jewelry.  The member has been in this business for some time, and it is by means of this business that she has been able to move ahead in life.  She sells her merchandise to her friends and family.  At the same time, Siyaya is also studying for a professional degree in accounting.  She is still in the middle of her professional degree, and wants to invest in her studies.

Siyaya is requesting the loan to pay for her monthly university fees.

She indicates to us that she is very satisfied and grateful for the support that is being given to her by these means, and she agrees to comply with the repayment of her debt in a timely manner.

loans.use: to pay for her monthly university fees.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a 35-year-old married woman. She has one child who is enrolled in school.

Mwanasiti operates a grocery selling business and sells her goods from home. She has worked in this business for 1 year. Her primary customers are villagers. Mwanasiti's other source of income includes her husband's income. She describes her greatest business challenge to be competition and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Mwanasiti will use the loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase tomatoes and potatoes for resale. Mwanasiti aspires to open a retail shop in the future. She joined Yehu because of low interest rates and good public relations.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Luis Esteban

texts.es: Luis Esteban  tiene 55 años de edad, el trabaja como guarda de seguridad ya tiene años de estar trabajando en una de las empresas de la localidad donde habita. Luis tiene una vivienda donde le quiere realizar algunas mejoras pero por falta de dinero no se las habías realizados, por tanto está solicitando financiamiento para realizar las mejoras a su vivienda y brindarle a su familia una mejor comodidad, con el crédito comprara Cemento, arena, piedrín  y  otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en: Luis Estaban is 55 years old, and works as a security guard. He has been employed for several years in one of the enterprises near where he lives. Luis has his own home and he wishes to make some improvement but due to the lack of money he hasn't been able to do so. Consequently, Luis is requesting a loan  to pay for these home improvements, thus offering his family greater comfort. With the loan he will purchase cement, sand, gravel, and other construction materials.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, gravel, and other construction materials for home improvement.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ru: Азиза проживает в городе Исфара. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж работает юристом. Сама она 7 лет как занимается торговлей ювелирных изделий. Она берет кредит для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Aziza lives in the city of Isfara.  She is 50 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband works as a legal professional.  Aziza has been involved in selling jewelry for seven years.  She is requesting this loan to expand merchandise selection.

loans.use: to purchase gold jewelry

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en:
Mwanamvua is a 40-year-old married woman. She has three children, all of whom are enrolled in school.

Mwanamvua operates a kiosk and sells her goods in a shop. She's worked in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are villagers. Mwanamvua's other source of income includes farming. She describes her greatest business challenge to be competition and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Mwanamvua will use the loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase sacks of beans and sugar, and cooking fat oil. Mwanamvua aspires to open a wholesale shop in the future. She joined Yehu because of low interest rates and good public relations.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans and sugar, and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Abduali

texts.ru: Абдуали проживает в городе Исфара. Ему 61 год. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он занимается шитьем чехлов для салона машины. Ему помогают его дети. Этим видом деятельности он занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для покупки необходимых тканей.
texts.en: Abduali lives in the city of Isfara.  He is 61 years old, married and has three children.  He is involved in sewing car seat covers.  His children help him with this business.  Abduali has been in this business for five years.  He is requesting this loan to purchase necessary fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase necessary fabrics

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: This is 37-year-old Emmanuel. He is married and has two children, ages 10 and 15. He has three additional dependents living with him. In 2006, Emmanuel established his provision-and-bar business. He began his business because he needed a reliable source of income to provide for his family. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL to buy more provisions and drinks for his business. In the future, Emmanuel plans to open another outlet that will be managed by his wife. He is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions for his business

loans.name: Siupolu

texts.en:
Siupolu is 49 years old, married, and has six children. Siupolu owns and operates a business providing general clothing services to local community members. She has four years of experience in this business. Siupolu needs a loan of 1,800 WST to purchase additional equipment and tools such as needles and threads. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 WST per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2008, Siupolu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Siupolu's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment and tools such as needles and threads

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora is 33 years old, married, and has one child. Dora sells fried foods in the local community. She has two years of experience in this business. Dora needs a loan of 1,500 WST to purchase a sack of potatoes, chicken, and cooking oil. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 WST per week) to pay for her child's tuition fees.

In 2011, Dora joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Dora's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of potatoes, chicken, and cooking oil

loans.name: Lotonuu

texts.en:
Lotonuu is 22 years old and married. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has one year of experience in this business.    

Lotonuu needs a loan of 1,000 WST to purchase weed killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 WST per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2012, Lotonuu joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Lotonuu's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killer.

loans.name: Sarine

texts.en:
Sarine has been engaged in her agricultural business for about 5 years. In her farm, Sarine rears cows and calves, sheep and lambs, and also chickens. Sarine grows potatoes as well. The products she produces are milk, eggs, meat, and potatoes, which Sarine’s family resells and thus supports themselves.

Sarine is 25 years old and she lives in Tsovagyugh village, in the area of Sevan. She is married and she has two small children. Also with Sarine’s family live her parents-in-law. All members of the family help Sarine in farming, as they do not have regular work; the agricultural business is the only source of income for them.

Sarine needs a $2,500 USD loan to buy some calves to develop her farm, a large lot of fodder for her farm animals, and potato seedlings for sowing.

loans.use: to buy some calves, a large lot of fodder for her farm animals, and potato seedlings for sowing.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 42 years old and married with eight children. She is starting a business harvesting taro. 

Christina needs a loan of 1300 WST to purchase harvesting equipment, such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 WST, or about 167 USD, per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2008, Christina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Christina's third loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment.

loans.name: Onolina

texts.en:
Onolina is 19 years old and single. She is starting a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale.    

Onolina needs a loan of 1500 WST to purchase additional seeds and young crops to raise. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated at 400 WST, or about 167 USD, per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2011, Onolina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Onolina's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Mery;la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de artesania como trabajos en ceramica vasijas,adornos y juegos de ajedres, la socia tiene un stand en Pisac donde vende todos su mercaderia a las personas que le solicitan,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de seguir adelante siendo de esta manera que la socia saca asu familia adelante.

La socia solicito el prestamo para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio (juegos de ajedres)y de esta manera tener mas mercaderia que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Mery belongs to the “Choquequirao” Communal Bank.  She lives in Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco.  

Mery alternates her daily activities with her handicraft business.  She has a stand in the village of Pisac, where she sells merchandise that includes ceramic works such as pots, ornaments, and chess sets.  Her items are much in demand.  Mery is very responsible and hard working, and has a strong desire to continue with her work so she can get ahead with her family.
 
Mery has asked for a loan to purchase merchandise for her business—specifically, chess sets—so she can offer her customers a greater selection.

Mery is very grateful for the loan that has been offered, since it will allow her to grow her business and improve her quality of life.  She promises to make her payments on time and in accordance with the terms of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase chess sets for her handicrafts business so she can offer her customers more products.

loans.name: Ayyub

texts.en:
Ayyub has been engaged in agriculture for 11 years. He is 50 years old, is married, and has two children. Ayyub's eldest son is 24 years old; he works as a police officer and helps his father to support the family.

Ayyub sells the meat at a bazaar and milk at his yard. Today he has five heads of cattle and he wants to buy two more calves to expand the sphere of his business. Ayyub needs 1200 Azerbaijan New Manats (AZN) for this. He hopes for your support.

loans.use: To buy two calves to expand the sphere of his business.

loans.name: Lusa

texts.en:
Lusa is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Safotu.  She is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Lusa owns and operates a business  raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business is planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Lusa has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 1500 WST a month from these activities.

In 2008, Lusa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lusa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1900 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Lusa is now requesting a new loan of 2000 WST, which will be used to purchase weed killers, such as Gramoxome. 

This loan will be the fourth loan Lusa has taken from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food stuffs for his business.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
This is Fanta. She is 34, married, and has five children aged 16, 13, 11, 7, and 5 years. She also has two additional dependents who live with her because she assists them with their schooling.  

In 2009, Fanta established her business. She began her business because, after her father's death when she was a child, there was no one to support her. Her mother gave her in marriage to a contractor, who gave her money to start a business. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month from this business. 

Fanta would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Fanta has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy cigarettes, water, and biscuits for sale and to pay employees.  

In the future, Fanta plans to build a house and acquire a shop. Fuel expenses are one of her main challenges. Fanta describes herself as hard-working and trustworthy. She has expanded her business, and she hopes to receive more support from ARD to accomplish her dream. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes, water, and biscuits for sale and to pay employees.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 52 years old, married, and has five adult children.  She lives in the town of Patamea.  To make a living, Francis owns and operates a fishing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling farm-raised fish in the local community.  Francis has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 600 WST a month.

In 2010, Francis joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Francis has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to raise.  Francis is  requesting her second loan for 1,500 WST, which she will use to purchase a new fishing net, spears, and a canoe.  Francis plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new fishing net, spears, and a canoe

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is Isatu. She is 59, a widow, and has three children aged 39, 35, and 30. In 2010, Isatu established her business. Isatu did not attend school, but, after she was married, her husband, a businessman, gave her some money to start petty trading. Now, working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 1,300,000 SLL every month. 

Isatu would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. She requires a loan in order to buy grains for sale and pay for transportation. This loan will help to increase her stock and also sales. In the future, Isatu plans to have a bigger business and own a shop. She describes herself as an honest and hardworking business woman. Isatu is looking forward to taking out further loans after she repays this one. She thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy grains for sale and pay for transportation.

loans.name: Ibrahim M.

texts.en:
This is Ibrahim. He is 29, single, and has one child aged two years. In 2005, Ibrahim established his retail business. Working seven days a week and 17 hours a day, he earns about 2,246,000 SLL every month from this business. His major challenges are limited capital and frequent increases in prices. 

Ibrahim would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL. He has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to purchase items for sale, such as batteries, cigarettes, sardines, sugar, and bath soap. He will use the remaining funds to pay laborers. The loan will help him to improve his business. He will continue to take loans from ARD until he has a bigger shop. 

In the future, Ibrahim plans to purchase land and build a house, further his education to university level, and educate his children. He describes himself as a hardworking and dedicated businessman. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase items for sale and pay employees.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
This is Juma. She is 55, a widow, and has five children aged 39, 34, 30, 24 and 19 years. She also has three additional dependents who live with her because she fosters them. 

In 1997, Juma established her business. Juma says she did not attend school because her parents did not believe in educating girl children. Instead, she worked with her mother selling goods. After she was married, her husband, a businessman, helped her establish a business of her own. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 2,000,000 SLL every month. One of the main challenges she faces in her business is customers who buy on credit but do not pay their bills on time.

Juma would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Juma requires the loan to buy groundnuts for sale. This loan will help her business to grow and generate more profit. In the future, Juma plans to build a shop, buy a car, and provide a quality education for her youngest child. She describes herself as a hard-working woman. Juma hopes you will continue to fund her business, and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts for sale.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre muy luchador, con esperanzas y la fuerza suficiente para poder salir adelante y demostrarse a sí mismo y a su familia, conformada por su esposa y a su bebe de 6 meses, que pueden lograr grandes cosas. Jose es un hombre que diariamente se levanta muy temprano para poder ofrecer su servicio de transporte en las horas donde hay mayor cantidad de clientes. Actualmente esta familia vive en la ciudad de Pisco, lugar que sufrió un terrible terremoto y muchos pobladores, entre ellos Jose, perdieron algunas de sus pertenencias.

Jose empezó alquilando una moto taxi, pero luego ahorrando poco a poco pudo comprarse  la moto que actualmente tiene, la misma que se ha desgastado con el paso del tiempo, y tiene problemas con la base y la pintura de su moto, la cual está muy desgastada, lo que peor aun la hace ver muy vieja.

Jose trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche, tiempo en el que solo se toma una hora para ir a casa y comer los alimentos que necesita. Su esposa siempre está pendiente de que él y su bebe estén bien, de esas manera todos se encontraran bien de salud y disminuirán el riesgo de pagar fuertes cantidades de dinero, con el que por el momento no cuentan.

El sueña con reforzar la base de su moto y hacer que pinten su moto, para que se vea mucho mejor y él pueda sentir la seguridad de que su moto durará mucho más. Es por esto que esta confiando en la ayuda que le podemos brindar, está muy comprometido con el pago de sus cuotas y agradecido por el apoyo que se le está brindando. Jose está seguro que sus ingresos podrán mejorar debido a que podrá llegar a lugares más lejanos, sin el miedo de que la moto taxi se malogre, lo que le permitirá incrementar sus ganancias y ahorrando un poco más podrá cumplir su gran sueño “Tener 3 moto taxis para alquilar y terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
José is a very tenacious man with hope and sufficient strength to be able to get ahead and demonstrate to himself and to his family, composed of his wife and 6 month old baby, that they can accomplish great things.  José is a man who rises very early every day to offer transportation services during the time when there are the most customers.  This family currently lives in the city of Pisco, a place that suffered a terrible earthquake in which many residents, José among them, lost some of their belonging.

José started out leasing a mototaxi but gradually saved up and was able to buy the one he now owns which over time has started to wear down; it has problems with the frame and needs to be painted because it’s very worn out and what’s worse, it makes it look very old.

José works from 7 in the morning until 9 at night and only takes an hour off to go home to eat the food he needs.   His wife is always watchful that he and their baby are well.  All of them are in good health as a result and avoid the risk of having to spend large amounts of money which at the moment they don’t have.

He dreams with strengthening the frame and painting his mototaxi so that it will look much better and he can feel sure that it will last much longer.  Because of this he’s counting on the help we can provide.  He is very committed to his installment payments and grateful for the support he’s being given.  José is sure that his income will be able to improve because he’ll be able to reach places that are farther away without fearing that his mototaxi’s motor will break down which will allow him to increase profits and be able to save up a bit more to reach his great dream: “To own three mototaxis to lease out and to finish building his house.”

loans.use: to paint and repair his mototaxi.

loans.name: Bai

texts.en:
This is Bai. He is 36, married, and has one child aged two years. He has two additional dependents, who live with him and help with his business while they attend school. In 2000, Bai established his business. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 2,200,000 SLL every month. One major challenge he faces is the unstable foreign exchange rate.

Bai would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. He requires a loan in order to purchase items for sale in his computer supply shop and to pay laborers. This will increase his working capital, and he is looking forward to subsequent loans.

Bai describes himself as hard-working and committed to his business. In the future, Bai plans to open a computer school. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase UPS- 2 pieces @ Le600,000, Hard Disk - 1 set @ Le1,500,000, Flash Drives - 10 pieces @ Le120,000 and A4 paper - 1 carton @ Le85,000.  The balance Le15,000 will be used to pay labourers.

loans.name: Amoka

texts.en:
Amoka is a kenkey (fermented corn dough) seller and a fishmonger at Kwahinkrom near Elmina.  Amoka has been into this business for 4 years now. She is married to a mason and has 4 children.  She assists her husband in the upkeep of their children.

Amoka will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and fish.  With the new profit, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish to sell

loans.name: Alimatu

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Alimatu from Tengbeh town, western area, in Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with no children for now. She also has two additional dependents at home. 

Alimatu runs a used items and cosmetics store; she sells chairs, creams, mattresses, computers, keyboards, bicycles, fans, and foam. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business seven days per week. She also earns from her husband who works in a (NGO) Non Governmental Organization. She also loans mobile phones on credit to customers. She says that the main challenge to her business is high competition in the business.

Alimatu has requested a loan in order to buy more used items and cosmetics. The extra income from this loan will allow her to responsible on home affairs. In the future, she plans to open an outlet in a different location. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: To buy more used items and cosmetics such as chairs, computers, creams, and mattresses.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es una mujer luchadora, que tras la separación y abandono de su esposo, ha demostrado ser una mujer muy fuerte, deseosa de poder sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos, el menor de 12 y el mayor de 17 años, de los cuales se siente muy orgullosa. Esta pequeña familia vive actualmente en la ciudad de Ica, Perú, lugar que en los últimos meses ha sufrido de fuertes temblores y lluvias, en las que Norma se ha visto afectada, ya que los productos que vende, tardaban mucho más en llegar y a un precio más elevado.

Norma se dedica a la venta de tubérculos y verduras a partir de las 6 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, en esta labor diaria sus hijos también buscan la manera de apoyarla trabajando con ella o tomando su lugar por algunas horas.

Norma necesita apoyo y así ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Ella quiere comprar papas, limones, camotes, etc. Para su pequeño y puesto, con el dinero que le sobre desea cumplir su sueño de mejorar su casa. Ella está muy comprometida en hacer crecer su negocio, que sus productos se vendan rápidamente y así incrementar sus ingresos. Lo que le permitirá poco a poco ampliar su negocio y lograr rápidamente juntar el dinero necesario para convertir a sus hijos en unos grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Norma is a tenacious woman who after her separation and abandonment by her husband, has shown that she’s a strong woman who wants to move her two children who are 12 and 17 years old ahead; she is very proud of them.  This small family currently lives in the city of Ica, Perú, a place that in the last few months has suffered from strong earthquakes and rain which have affected Norma since the products she sells took longer to arrive and their price was higher.

Norma sells tubers and vegetables from 6am until 7pm; her children also find ways of helping her with her work or taking over for her for a few hours.

Norma needs support so that she can be able to improve income and improve her family’s quality of life.  She wants to buy potatoes, lemons, sweet potatoes, etc. for her small stand and with money left over she wants to reach her dream of improving her house.  She’s very committed to make her business grow, that her products sell quickly and to quickly amass the money necessary to turn her children into great professionals.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, lemons, sweet potatoes, etc. and to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Hawa O.

texts.en:
This is 59-year-old Hawa O. She is married with eight adult children. In 1980, Hawa O. established her food stall. She started it because she did not go to school, and her parents were traders who trained her in their business. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 
She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy eggs (5 cartons @ Le260,000), maggie (9 cartons @ Le175,000) and tomato ketchup (4 cartons @ Le30,000). In the future, Hawa O. plans to improve her business and save enough for retirement.  
The rainy season is her major challenge. Hawa O. is hardworking. She wants money to buy more stock and is looking forward to accessing more loans.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy eggs, maggie, and tomato ketchup.

loans.name: Uulbubu

texts.ru:
Уулбубу 43 года, замужем, воспитала 4  детей. В качестве дохода для своей семьи, Уулбубу с 2010 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав со стартовой суммы в 30,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости,  в хозяйстве Уулбубу на сегодняшний  день имеется  7 дойных коров,  10 овец, заготовлено 1 тонна фасоли.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Уулбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп удобрения для земли и дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Уулбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Uulbubu is 43 years old, married and raised four children.  To provide a source of income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 2010, starting this business with an initial amount of 30,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her hard work and persistence, Uulbubu's business now contains seven dairy cows, ten sheep and has a stock of 1 ton of beans.  In order to further develop her business, Uulbubu requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase fertilizers for land and additional heads of livestock.  She plans to invest the earnings into a further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and fertilizers

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Salamatu. She is married with four children aged 11, 9, 7 and 6 years. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her because he attends school in the city with her financial assistance.  
In 1995, Salamatu established her business. She began her business because she was not fortunate enough to have a formal education. She had to join her aunt in trading from place to place.  
Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month from. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Salamatu has already received and successfully repaid her first loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy flour (6 bags @ Le 150,000) and rice (20 bags @ Le 156,000). In the future, Salamatu plans to open another outlet. 
The loan will help as it will increase her working capital. Competition is great but she always has a variety and high quality of goods. Salamatu is hardworking. She appreciates ARD's effort as it has helped her a lot over the past months as she has purchased new goods for her store. Salamatu is looking forward to using more loans. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy flour and rice.

loans.name: Las Algas Marina Group

texts.es:
Elideth cuenta 33 años de edad es casada, tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando bulmaro estudia el bachiller, isela esta en 2° de secundaria y Antonio esta en 1° de secundaria, su esposo se llama bulmaro es campesino.

Ella tiene un puesto de comida donde vende desayunos y variedades de platillos dice que le va muy bien en el negocio, con esta ayuda espera que el negocio incremente más, e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza para elabora la comida y desayunos como son: frutas, verduras, pan, carne, jamón, huevos, chorizo, etc. Elideth esta muy agradecida con el apoyo brindado ella espera en dios que todo salga bien.

Elideth pertenece a un grupo llamado algas marinas cuyo nombre fue puesto porque todas las integrantes viven en un poblado donde esta una playa grande muy linda con rocas, el grupo esta integrado por 9 mujeres trabajadoras las cuales todas cuenta con un negocio a continuación serán mencionadas: Verónica tiene venta de ropa, Edelmira venta de comida, Maria del Mar comida antojitos, Ma Felix comida y ropa, Antonia productos de abarrotes, Eva quesos y ropa, Georgina venta de comida, Cipriana venta de comida.
texts.en:
Elideth, 33, is married and has three children currently attending school.  Bulmaro is in high school, Isela is in 8th grade and Antonio is in 7th grade.  Her husband's name is Bulmaro and he’s a farmer.

She has a food stand where she sells breakfasts and various dishes.  She says she does very well in the business.  She hopes with this help that business will grow more.  She will use the loan to buy ingredients she uses to prepare the food and breakfasts like: fruit, vegetables, bread, meat, ham, eggs, chorizo, etc.  Elideth is very grateful for the support provided and she trusts in God that everything will turn out well.

Elideth belongs to a group called “Algas Marinas” (Marine Algae) and this name was chosen because all the members live in a town that has a large, very beautiful rocky beach.  The group consists of 9 hardworking women each with her own business which will be mentioned next: Verónica sells clothes, Edelmira sells food, María del Mar sells fast food snacks, María Félix sells food and clothes, Antonia sells groceries, Eva sells cheese and clothes, Georgina sells food and Cipriana sells food.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, bread, meat, ham, eggs, chorizo, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase vegetable oil, iodine salt, maggie and couscous.

loans.name: Takhmina

texts.ru: Тахмина жительница города Исфара. Ей 37 лет. Она замужем. У нее имеется пекарня, где она вместе в мужем печет лепешку. В этой области она двенадцать лет. Кредит берет для покупки муки и угля.
texts.en: Takhmina is a resident of the city of Isfara.  She is 37 years old, married.  She has a bakery, where she and her husband bake flatbread.  Takhmina has been in this business for twelve years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase flour and coal.

loans.use: to purchase flour and coal

loans.name: Gulya

texts.ru:
Гулае 55 лет, замужем, воспитала 4 детей. В 1995 году, в поисках дохода для своей семьи, Гулая начала заниматься животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 10,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Гулаи на сегодняшний  день имеется  4 дойные коровы, 1 голова теленка, 3 головы овец и 1 голова лошади. Доходы от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов составляют от 10,000 до 60,000 сом (KGS) в квартал.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулая обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Гулая планирует вложить в ремонт сарая, а в дальнейшем - в увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Gulya is 55 years old, married and raised four children. In search of a source of income for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry in 1995, starting this business with an initial amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Today Gulya's business contains four dairy cows, one calf, three sheep and one horse. The earnings from sales of milk and meat products range from 10,000 to 60,000 som (KGS) per quarter.  In order to further develop her business, Gulya requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of livestock. She plans to invest the earnings into repairing a barn and expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Konul

texts.en: Konul is a 33-year-old widowed woman with two children. They live together with her mother. She is engaged in agriculture, selling calves to butchers and earning additional income from agriculture to support her family. They have a building made from air bricks next to the house, but she wants to obtain 500 Azerbaijan New Manats (AZN) to rebuild it from stone. Konul also works as a educator at the kindergarten.

loans.use: To rebuild a house with stone.

loans.name: Andy Umarr

texts.en: This is 42-year-old Andy. He is married with two children aged eight and six. He has two additional dependents, who live with him because he assists them in their schooling and accommodations. In 2000, Andy established his business. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,900,000 every month. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Andy requires a loan in order to buy cane sticks (5 dozen @ Le 10,000), foam (10 pieces @ Le 150,000), (velvet fabric - 50 yards @ Le 10,000) and leather (20 yards @ Le25,000). In the future, Andy plans to open another shop, build another house, and provide quality education for his children. This loan will help to improve his business. It is sometimes difficult to get the raw materials, especially the cane. He is hardworking and honest. Andy hopes to get another loan after paying back this one. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cane sticks, foam, velvet fabric and leather.

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica de 46 años, vive con su cónyuge y tiene un hijo de 18 años de edad, con quien sueña verlo convertido en una persona de mucho éxito, por eso trabaja persistentemente para poder apoyarlo. Ella inició su negocio de vender comidas rápidas, por la necesidad de generar su propia fuente de empleo, pero como no tenia capital de trabajo suficiente,  recurrió a hacer una sociedad en la que no le fue muy bien y por eso se independizó en otro lugar con su clientela,  que cada día crece mucho más. Su gran desafío es ubicarse nuevamente en el punto que se  había cotizado, cuando formó parte de la sociedad, porque además es muy conocida y tiene mayor movimiento. En la actualidad está experimentando con nuevos productos como almuerzos y comidas  y le está yendo bien,  pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para hacer compras significativas, que le representen descuentos y con los cuales pueda aspirar al aumento de su oferta. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas, e insumos, para responde a sus pedidos de almuerzos diarios, producto de su preventa y fortalecer su ingreso, porque el de las comidas rápidas, es solo los fines de semana. Esta es justamente el éxito de esta inversión, pues con ella aspira a ganar un poco mas aumentará su capacidad de ingresos y aumentará su sostenibilidad financiera.
texts.en:
Mónica is 46, and lives with her partner. She has an 18-year-old son, and she dreams of seeing him become a very successful person. That is why she works tirelessly to be able to support him. 

She started her business of selling fast-foods because she needed to generate her own source of employment, but as she did not have enough working capital, she resorted to a partnership, which didn't go very well, and that's why she went independent in another location with her own clientele, which is growing a lot every day. 

Her great challenge is to locate herself again in the spot which, when she was part of the partnership, had increased in value; because in addition to it being very well-known, it is in a busier area. 

Currently she is experimenting with new products such as lunches and meals, and it's going very well. But her working capital is insufficient to make major purchase that offer discounts, and through which she can aspire to increase her sales. This is the reason why she is applying for her credikiva loan, the first she is getting from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. 

Through the loan, she will buy ingredients and supplies in order to fill her daily lunch orders, which she sells in advance. This will enable her to build up her income, because her fast-food sales are only on weekends.

This is precisely how this investment will succeed, as through it, she aspires to earn a bit more; she will increase her earning capacity and her financial sustainability.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies in order to fill her daily lunch orders.

loans.name: Umaru Fullah

texts.en: This is 26 year-old Umaru. He is single and has no children. In 2010, Umarr established his business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,800,000 every month. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,500,000. Umaru has already received and successfully repaid his first loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy jeans and crepe fabric.  He will use the balance of Le 100,000 to pay for transportation. In the future, Umaru plans to expand his business, engage in further studies and build a house. The loan will help him to have more stock. His challenges are fluctuation in foreign currencies. He is a hardworking businessman. He prays that there will be no stumbling blocks in the repayment. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy jeans and crepe fabric, and pay for transportation.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Las Orquidias Group

texts.es:
El grupo orquídeas se encuentra en un lugar llamado Ejido de Santiago esta conformado por 12 personas muy trabajadoras 10 mujeres y dos hombres que se dedican a la ganadería el grupo se llama a si porque anteriormente estaban participando en otro crédito y así se llamaba el grupo y fue como se quedo el nombre.
La señora Alicia tiene 55 años de edad está casada desde hace 35 años con el señor Gustavo quien trabaja de empleado en una compañía ya no tiene niños que dependan de ellos, Doña Alicia se dedica a la crianza de cerdos ella se encarga de limpiarlos, darles de comer, para cuando los animales estén ya crecidos los pueda vender, esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para poder comprar 12 cerdos y lo que quede será para alimento comenta que en la actividad lleva ya 6 años inicio su actividad ya que es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora entonces quería tener otro ingreso para su familia.
La única dificultad a la que se enfrenta es cuando los cerdos enferman y mueren porque es una perdida muy grande para la familia.
Una meta de doña Alicia es que su actividad con los cerdos siga creciendo porque las ganancias les beneficia mucho a ella y a su familia por lo que Doña Alicia y el resto del grupo están muy agradecido con FRAC y Kiva por la préstamo otorgado porque gracias a el podrán invertir y sus ganancias serán mayores.
Los integrantes del grupo invertirán: María del Carmen, Jaime, Joaquín, Carmen, Ofelia, Celinda, Amalia, Susana  invertirán  en borregos, Guadalupe en una becerra, Victoria invertirá en cerdos.
texts.en:
The Orquídeas (Orchids) group can be found in a place called Ejido de Santigago.  The group is comprised of 12 hardworking people, 10 women and 2 men.  They devote themselves to raising cattle.  They gave their group this name because they were previously participating with another loan, and that was what the group was called.  That is how the name stayed the same.

Alicia, age 55, has been married to Gustavo for 35 years.  He works as an employee in a company.  They do not have children who are still dependent upon them.

Alicia raises pigs.  She takes charge of cleaning and feeding them so that she will be able to sell them when they are grown.

This time she has requested a loan to be able to buy 12 pigs.  She says that the rest of the loan will be used to buy feed.  She has been engaged in this business activity for six years.  She started this business because she is a responsible and very hard-working person.  She wanted to have another income for her family.

The only difficulty that she faces is when the pigs get sick and die.  This is a big loss for the family.  One of Alicia’s goals is for her pig business to keep growing because the income is of great benefit to her and to her family.  

Alicia and the rest of the group are very grateful to FRAC and Kiva for the loan that was granted.  Thanks to the loan they will be able to invest in their businesses, and they will have greater income.  The members of the group that will invest are María del Carmen, Jaime, Joaquín, Carmen, Ofelia, Celinda, and Amalia.  Susana will buy in a sheep, Guadalupe a calf, and Victoria will buy pigs.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
Juanita cuenta con 39 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene 5 hijos Fernando es el mayor tiene 21 años de edad ya no estudia, trabaja en el campo al igual que Noe de 20 años ya no estudia pero trabaja, Juan Antonio esta el bachiller cursando 3° grado ya no piensa estudiar, Nancy Sandibel de 15 años esta cursando primer año del bachiller y Alexis de 12 años esta en 6° grado de primaria.

Juanita se dedica al comercio tiene la venta de pan ya tiene 15 años con el negocio, ella dice que le va muy bien con el negocio sale a vender en el pueblo con una canasta y también lo vende por pedido lo cual dice que le va bien vende dos veces por semana,  espera que le vaya mejor e invertirá su préstamo en la compra de los insumos que utiliza para elaborar el pan como son: harina, aceite, manteca, azúcar, etc. Ella esta contenta espera darle gran utilidad al préstamo espera que el negocio siga incrementado hasta ahora esta agradecida con el apoyo brindado.

Juanita pertenece al grupo san Juan el cual esta formado por un hombre y 17 mujeres las cuales son personas trabajadoras que cuenta con pequeños negocios de diferentes tipos a continuación serán mencionados: Maria, MA del Carmen, Noel, Miroslaba, Silveria, Dominga, Ramira, Elvira, Yeni Leni, Elizabeth, María, Exaelia, Bictoria, Sofía, Yamislet, Abasita, Anastasia, todas cuenta con actividades comerciales como son: venta de verduras, pan, frutas, dulces, productos de abarrotes, productos agrícolas como fríjol y maíz, etc.
texts.en:
Juanita, 39, is a single mother of five children.  Fernando is the oldest, he’s 21 and no longer attends school; he’s a field worker just like Noé, 20, who no longer attends school but does work.  Juan Antonio is in high school; he’s in 12th grade and doesn’t plan to study any more.  Nancy Sandibel, 15, is in 10th grade and Alexis, 12, is in 6th grade in elementary school.

Juanita is a merchant; she’s been selling bread for 15 years.  She says that she does very well with the business.  She goes out into the town with a basket to sell bread and also sells it on order which she says she does well; she sells twice a week.  She hopes that she’ll do better and will use the loan to buy the ingredients she uses to make the bread like: flour, oil, shortening, sugar, etc.  She is happy and hopes to get a lot out of the loan.  She hopes the business will continue growing like it’s done to date.  She is grateful for the support provided.

Juanita belongs to the “San Juan” group which is composed of one man and 17 women who are hardworking people with small businesses of different types that we mention here:  María, María del Carmen, Noel, Miroslava, Silveria, Dominga, Ramira, Elvira, Yeni Leni, Elizabeth, María, Exaelia, Victoria, Sofía, Yamislet, Abasita and Anastasia all have commercial activities like sale of vegetables, bread, fruit, candy, groceries and farm products like beans, corn, etc.

loans.use: to buy bread baking ingredients.

loans.name: Mira

texts.ru:
Мире 51 год, вдова, воспитала 5 детей. В 1995 году, в поисках дохода для своей семьи, Мира начала заниматься животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 15,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Миры на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 дойные коровы, 3 головы бычков, 5 головы овец и 1 голова лошади. Доходы от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов составляют примерно 6,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Мира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Mira is 51 years old, a widow and raised five children. In search of a source of income for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry in 1995, starting this business with an initial amount of 15,000 som (KGS).  Today Mira's business contains two dairy cows, three bulls, five sheep and one horse. The earnings from sales of milk and meat products amount to about 6,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to further develop her business, Mira requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of livestock. She plans to invest the earnings into expanding her business further.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a farmer working in San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with two children aged twenty-six and twenty-two.  Susan’s husband works as a farmer as well.

Susan has been in the rice farming business for ten years. She earns PHP 4,000 per month through farming.  Susan has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labour.  Susan hopes this loan will help increase their harvest.  Susan also hopes to expand their farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labour for her farm.

loans.name: Nurila

texts.ru:
Нуриле 56 лет, замужем, воспитала 3 детей. В 2008 году, в поисках дохода для своей семьи, Нурила начала заниматься животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 10,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Нурилы на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 дойные коровы, 50 голов овец, 2 головы лошади, заготовлено 4 тележки сена и 1 тонна ячменя. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нурила обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на закуп дополнительных голов скота. Доходы от кредита Нурила планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Nurila is 56 years old, married and raised three children. In search of a source of income for her family, she became involved in animal husbandry in 2008, starting this business with an initial amount of 10,000 som (KGS). Today Nurila's business contains two dairy cows, fifty sheep and two horses, and has a stock of four loads of hay and one ton of barley.  In order to further develop her business, Nurila requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase additional heads of livestock. She plans to invest the earnings into expanding her business further.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Manot

texts.ru: Манот уже два года занимается животноводством. Ей 41 год. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Он берет кредит для закупа теленка.
texts.en: Manot has been involved in animal husbandry for two years.  She is 41 years old, married and has six children.  She is requesting this loan to buy a calf.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо проживает в районе Дангара. Она замужем. Ей 33 года. У нее четверо детей. Мархабо занимается торговлей женской и детской одежды. Она берет кредит для покупки сезонного товара.
texts.en: Marhabo lives in the Dangara district.  She is 33 years old, married and has four children.  Marhabo is involved in selling women's and children's clothing.  She is requesting this loan to purchase seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Fidelite De Dieu Group

texts.fr:
Lauraine est le coordinatrice de son groupe  FIDELITE DE DIEU du Cape Haitien, la région nord d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Elle n'est pas marié elle n'a pas d'enfants.

Lauraine a dirigé son commerce produit de beaute pendant les 3 dernières années.  Avant de commencer ce commerce Lauraine, etait un etudiante. Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt dans ventes produits cosmetique.

Lauraine espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à obtenir un plus grand commerce. Des autres membres de fidelite  ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vente de produits alimentaires et cosmetiques. Lauraine dit que son défi principal c'est d'avoir plus d'argent pour obtenir un plus grand commerce.

Lauraine dit que son rêve c'est d'avoir constuire une maison.
texts.en:
Lauraine is the coordinator of the  Fidelite de Dieu group of   Cap-Haïtien [coast], a region in the north of Haiti, where electricity is scarce and access to water very limited. She is single without children. She has been running a beauty products business for three years.  Before launching this business, Lauraine was a student. She would like to use this loan to buy cosmetic products for resale.

Lauraine hopes that this loan will allow her to  expand her business. The other group members also need loans for their businesses, such as selling groceries and cosmetic products. Lauraine says that her main challenge is to have a bigger capital in order to grow her business.
Her  dream is to have a house built.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Elisa is a 29-year-old married woman with three children, ages 8, 5 and 3. Her husband works as a fisherman and carpenter.

Elisa is a food vendor from Bien Unido, Bohol. She sells bananas and camote cue (deep-fried sweet potato covered with caramelized brown sugar), and rice cakes. Elisa also runs a small sari-sari (variety) store business located at her house. 

Elisa works hard to support her husband in providing for their family’s needs and sending their children to school. She applied for a loan to purchase sugar, flour, bananas, and more items to sell such as canned goods and toiletries. Elisa hopes to earn better and save for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour, bananas, and more items to sell such as canned goods and toiletries.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is an 18-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She started a food vending business a year ago. Marissa sells banana cue (deep-fried banana covered with caramelized brown sugar), camote (sweet potato) cue, rice cakes, and ice candy. She earns about 3,500 PHP per month with her business. Marissa does her best to support her husband and save for their future.

Marissa has requested a loan to buy bananas, camote, sugar, flour, and cooking oil. Marissa hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to buy bananas, camote (sweet potatoes), sugar, flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Dioscoro

texts.en: Dioscoro is a 42-year-old married man with three children ages 20, 16 and 12.  Dioscoro makes "tuba" (coconut wine) and vinegar to earn a living. Dioscoro earns about 3,500 PHP per month with this business.  Dioscoro owns a coconut farm, which is the source of his wine and vinegar.  Dioscoro works hard to increase his earnings and sustain his children's education.  He plans to use his loan to buy containers and food coloring.  Dioscoro hopes to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his wine and vinegar making business.

loans.name: Las Artesanas Del Fresno Group

texts.es:
El grupo de las Artesanas del Fresno está ubicado en  Fresno Nichi un lugar donde los arboles predominan, el grupo está conformado por 9 mujeres todas se dedican a la elaboración de artesanías que es el bordado, precisamente el grupo se llama Las Artesanas del Fresno Artesanas por la actividad a la que se dedican y fresno por el lugar donde viven.
Doña Rufina tiene 52 años de edad esta casada desde hace 32 años con el señor Santiago quien trabaja de obrero y agricultor aun tienen un niño  Aron Santiago que depende de ellos el cual está estudiando la primaria.
Doña Rufina se dedica al bordado nos cuenta que ya hace 32 años que se dedica a bordar, colchas, gabanes, chales, esquemesnes, tapetes con figuras representativas de la comunidad, las cuales son estrellas de trencillas, bordados de casita, figuras de caballo, y otros animalitos con el crédito otorgado doña Rufina comprara tela de lana, tela estambron, estambre de madeja para bordar, aujas, tijeras, etc.
Una de las dificultades mas grandes que presenta doña Rufina es que casi no se vende ya nuestra artesanía porque las personas no quieren pagar el precio a que se le da al cliente se le hace muy caro y muchas veces nuestro trabajo no es valorado como debería ser. Doña Rufina comenta que para la elaboración de dichos artículos se tardan de 20 días hasta un mes dependiendo del artículo que vayan hacer.
El préstamo que FRAC y Kiva les realizan al grupo de las Artesanas del Fresno es de gran ayuda ya que muchas veces no tiene para comprar sus materiales para la elaboración de sus actividades.
Por lo que ellas están muy agrdecidas por el préstamo otorgado por lo que resto del grupo invierte en: Angelina, Maria Juana, Lucina, Maria de los Angeles, Leonila, Maria Lucina invertiran en bordados de artesanias y Maria Iris en productos de Belleza.
texts.en:
The “Las Artesanas del Fresno” (The Ash Tree Artisans) group is located in Fresno Nichi a place where trees predominate.  It’s composed of nine women who are all embroidery craftswomen.  The group is called Las Artesanas del Fresno precisely because of the activity they carry out and ‘fresno’ because of the place they live in.

Rufina, 52, has been married to Santiago, who works as a laborer and farmer, for 32 years; they still have a little boy, Aron Santiago, who depends on them and is attending elementary school.

Rufina is an embroiderer and she mentions that she’s been doing this for 32 years; she embroiders bedspreads, ponchos, shawls, "quexquemetl" [embroidered lace cape], mats with figures representative of the community such as braided stars, embroidered little houses, horses and other little animals.  With the granted loan, Rufina will buy wool fabric, embroidery fabric, Madeja-style yarn, needles, scissors, etc.

One of Rufina’s greatest difficulties is that their type of crafts hardly sell anymore because people don’t want to pay the prices quoted to customers; they think they are too expensive and often their work is undervalued.  Rufina relates that it takes from 20 days to a month depending on the item to be made to complete said items.

The loan that FRAC and Kiva will provide for the Las Artesanas del Fresno group is of great help for them because often they are unable to buy the materials they need to make their items.  Because of this, they are very grateful for the loan granted that the entire group will invest:  Angelina, Maria Juana, Lucina, Maria de los Angeles, Leonila, Maria and Lucina will invest in their artisanal embroidery work and Maria Iris in beauty products.

loans.use: to buy fabric for embroidery.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 49 years old and married with three children, ages 20, 18 and 13.  Anecita's husband does coastal fishing.

Anecita has had a sari-sari store for 16 years.  She sells items like biscuits, cooking oil, vinegar, canned goods and spices.  Anecita has a monthly income of 6,000 PHP from her store.  She is doing her best to support her family, especially with her children's education.

Anecita is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell, such as soft drinks and canned goods.  Anecita hopes for her business to grow and for her children to finish college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Esperanza De Vida Group

texts.es:
Áurea cuenta con 42 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene un hijo que cursa 3° de preparatoria, ella se dedica al comercio venta de comida antojitos como son: tacos, quesadillas, tostadas, chicharrones, tiene 3 años con el negocio lo cual dice que le va muy bien con el negocio y invertirá su préstamo en la compra de los insumos como son: verduras, tortillas, carne, choriso, chicharrones, etc. En la venta le ayuda su hijo juntos están saliendo adelante y espera que sea una fuente de ingresos para ayudar a su  hijo a ser un gran profesionista.
