texts.fr: Sègbégnon Bernadette est âgée de 33 ans et vit au Bénin. Sègbégnon Bernadette est mariée à un certain Gabriel.  Sègbégnon Bernadette a très peu fréquenté, mais a appris la coiffure. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. En dehors de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Sègbégnon Bernadette et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Sègbégnon Bernadette exerce le métier de coiffure depuis quatorze ans environs. Cette activité lui permet ainsi de satisfaire aux besoins de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins. Sègbégnon Bernadette désire mieux équiper son atelier de coiffure par l’acquisition d’un séchoir et des produits de cheveux ; ce qui lui permettra de répondre efficacement aux exigences de sa clientèle. Pour cette raison, Sègbégnon Bernadette sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Sègbégnon Bernadette is 33 years old and lives in Benin.  She is married to a man named Gabriel.  She has only attended school for a very short period of time, but has learned the trade of hair-dressing. Sègbégnon Bernadette and Gabriel have four children, some of whom attend school.  Besides their own children, the couple has another child in their care.  Sègbégnon Bernadette and her husband jointly take care of the various household expenses.

In order to cope with her various expenses, Sègbégnon Bernadette has been working as a hairdresser for about fourteen years.  Thanks to this activity she is able to provide for her children and for herself.

Sègbégnon Bernadette would like to better equip her hair-dressing salon through the purchase of a hair dryer and other hair care products.  Those purchases will enable her to efficiently meet the needs of her customers.  For this reason, she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.  Her two previous loans have been well repaid.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and other hair care products.

loans.name: Lhamsuren

texts.en: Lhamsuren is a 65-year-old widowed woman who lives with her daughter in Huvsgul province in Northern Mongolia. Her daughter is 21 years old and employed. She has been running a garment retail business since 2000. She started the business in the shop counter of the biggest trade center in the town. She became experienced on the field. She has many regular customers and plans to expand the business activity by increasing the types. Lhamsuren is a smart lady who says that "I would like to expand the business activity by purchasing the garments in large quantities so that I could raise the income". The total amount she is requesting is 2,500,000 MNT which she will use to purchase more garments.

loans.use: To purchase more garments

loans.name: Americo

texts.en:
Americo and his partner together operate a number of small businesses to support themselves and their four-year-old. In total, the couple have about five small carts from which they sell everything from quail eggs to jean pants to jewelry. Americo typically travels on weekends from Saturday to Sunday in order to sell merchandise from Cusco in smaller towns such as Sicuani.

Americo would like a loan in order to purchase more merchandise for his businesses, primarily quail eggs and earrings at wholesale. He and his partner would like to own a stand in the future, and perhaps open a store outside of Cusco city where Americo currently travels to sell merchandise. 

Americo is a member of the village bank "El Amanecer" in Cusco, which is receiving its 22nd loan from Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to purchase quail eggs and earrings for his businesses

loans.name: Gantsetseg

texts.en: Gantsetseg is a 39-year-old woman who lives with her husband and three children in Selenge province in Northern Mongolia. Two of her children study at the secondary school and the youngest one is three years old. She has been running a garment retail business since 2010. She has been running the business with her husband. They deliver the products with their own van from the border city. But due to the bad roads, the van has been broken and it needs to be replaced. Therefore in order to continue running the business, they need to replace the van. They plan to buy a sedan with the loan and their saved money. Gantsetseg is a smart lady who says.  "I would like to expand the business activity by having a sedan so that I and my husband continue the business between the border cities and improve the household". The total amount she is requesting is 3,500,000 MNT to buy a new car.

loans.use: To buy a new car

loans.name: Rahmajon

texts.ru: Рахматчон мужчина 40 лет, женат и имеет шестерых детей.Его жена домохозяйка. В своей местности он знаменитый электрик,у него очень много клиентов . Также он имеет не большую землю , где посеял укроп и петрушку, которую будет продавать на рынке его жена. Он также имеет свой бизнес ,по откорму и продажи скота. На приобретенный  кредит он хочет купить две молодые коровы, и откормив их продать за хорошую цену.
texts.en: Rahmajon is a 40 year old man, he is married and has six children. His wife is a homemaker. He is a well known electrician in his neighborhood and has very many clients. He also has a small plot of land where he planted dill and parsley which his wife will sell on the market. He also has his own business feeding and selling livestock. He wants to use the loan to buy two young cows and sell them for a good price after fattening.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Nawal Group

texts.en:
Nawal is a 51-year-old married woman and mother of three children. Nawal has worked as a tailor for 10 years. She started her business to help her husband make a living and raise their children. She stopped working for a few years when she found out that her children needed a lot of care and attention, but two years ago Nawal felt lonely since all of her children got married and she was left alone during the day busy with nothing to prepare for the kids who were supposed to be back home for lunch or dinner.

So working again was the best thing for her to improve her social life in addition to supporting her family again with additional income for whoever needs help. She is very happy that she took this path again, and she is willing to open a big factory in the future. Today, Nawal is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new and improved tailoring machine capable of doing a lot of work in a very short amount of time with especially good quality.

Khadija is a 25-year-old married woman and mother of three gorgeous children who fill her whole life, and for whom she sacrifices hers in order to please them and provide them with the best living ever. Three years ago, Khadija started to work as a hairdresser. She faced a lot of problems and complaints from her husband at the beginning since he refused to let her work and start her own business. But at the same time, she had her husband's family's support, which helped a lot in taking the first step. Her business started at home, since her husband spends most of his time away and she had to fill her free time and at the same time stay next to her children. Most of her customers are friends, relatives and neighbors. Khadija is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary hair colors, a new hairdryer and necessary hair dressing tools to improve her business. She hopes that one day she will open her own beauty salon and all of her customers will support her there too since they are very loyal to her. She is sure that her husband, although he refused at the beginning, is very proud of her now.

Zalfa is a 43-year-old married woman and mother of three children. Zalfa has been working in the Mouneh business for 13 years. She inherited her business from her mother who used to do it in her village. That's what encouraged her to start this business in her husband's village. Zalfa makes jam, she prepares Mouneh during the summer months to be consumed during winter’s harsh days. This way of preserving food helps foods to live a longer life. The Mouneh food has started in time to be a basic food for most of the Lebanese. Her business is improving and now is the suitable time to start working since everything is almost available to start preparing. That's why, to be ready for customers' replies, Zalfa is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary goods such as vegetables, fruits and seeds , to start her preparations.

loans.use: To purchase a tailoring machine

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. She doesn't take care of additional family members. Milly has a beauty salon. She has been in this business for eight years and she works 7 days out of every week.  Milly sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Milly has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids.    
 
The main business challenge(s) for Milly include the rainy season and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked beauty salon and to have a permanent place for her salon. Milly lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids

loans.name: Khvicha

texts.en:
Khvicha is 32 years old. He lives in a small village in the Gori district with his family: parents and younger sister (a student). The family earns a living through an agricultural business. They run a dairy farm with five milk cows and three calves. They sell on average 100 kg of cheese per month in the village. Along with the dairy farm, the family has 2.3 hectares of land where plum, peach and apple trees are grown. Khvicha sells the harvested fruits in the village to local greengrocery retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 480 Laris.

Khvicha requested credit for purchasing fertilizers and drugs for treating the plants from parasites. After properly completed seasonal work, the family will get a good harvest and sell harvested products for convenient price. It will be positively reflected on the family income and they will be able to improve the family members’ living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and drugs for treating his plants against parasites

loans.name: Comlan Irenée

texts.fr: Comlan Irenée est âgé de 39 ans et vit au Bénin. Comlan Irenée est marié à Cathérine. Comlan Irenée a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire, puis a appris la photographie. Le couple a cinq enfants à charge, dont trois sont ses propres enfants. Tous les enfants du couple sont scolarisés. Comlan Irenée et sa femme assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Comlan Irenée exerce le métier de photographie depuis quinze ans environs. Cette activité lui permet ainsi de satisfaire aux besoins de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins. Comlan Irenée désire mieux équiper son atelier de photographie par l’acquisition d’un mini-labo ; ce qui lui permettra d'améliorer ses prestations. Pour cette raison, Comlan Irenée sollicite pour la deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Comlan Irenée is 39 years old and lives in Benin. Comlan Irenée is married to Catherine. Comlan Irenée stopped school at the secondary level, then learned photography. The couple has five children in their care, three of whom are their own. All of the couple's children are in school. Comlan Irenée and his wife provide for the various household expenses together. To cope with his various expenses, Comlan Irenée has worked as a photographer for around fifteen years. This business allows him to satisfy the needs of his children and to provide for his own needs. Comlan Irenée wants to better equip his photography studio by acquiring a mini lab. This will allow him to improve his performance. For this reason, Comlan Irenée is asking for a loan from Alidé for the second time. His first loan was fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy a mini-lab for photography.

loans.name: Evènassé François

texts.fr: Evènassé François est âgé de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Evènassé François est marié à Christine. Le couple a cinq enfants à leur charge dont quatre sont leurs propres enfants. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Evènassé François vit ensemble avec  ses  enfants et sa femme et assure ensemble avec sa femme les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Evènassé François mène comme activité l'activité de forgeron et d'ajustage. De façon secondaire, Evènassé François vend des jus de bissap, de la glace, etc. dans son quartier. Evènassé François exerce cette activité passionnément depuis près de dix ans. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Evènassé François contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille.Evènassé François  s’approvisionne au Bénin et au Nigéria. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Evènassé François sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement par Evènassé François ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Evènassé François is 38 years old and lives in Benin. Evènassé François is married to Christine. The couple has five children in their care, four of whom are their own. Some of the children are in school. Evènassé François lives together with his children and his wife and provides for the various household expenses together with his wife. To meet his needs and those of his children, Evènassé François works as a blacksmith and adjuster. Secondarily, Evènassé François sells bissap juice (a sweet juice made with hibiscus), ice cream, etc. in his area. Evènassé François has been in this business for nearly ten years. Thanks to the revenue that this business generates, Evènassé François contributes to the various expenses of his family. Evènassé François stocks up in Benin and in Nigeria. To satisfy the needs of his growing number of customers, Evènassé François is asking for a third loan from Alidé. His past loans were repaid in full.

loans.use:
Acheter des meules, poste à soudure, sucre, arômes, feuilles de bissap.
To buy grinding stones, a welder, sugar, flavorings, hibiscus flowers.
